oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Non-adiabatic optomechanical Hamiltonian of a moving dielectric membrane in a cavity
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cheung, H. K.
Law, C. K.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quantum Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We formulate a non-relativistic Hamiltonian in order to describe the interaction between a moving dielectric membrane and radiation pressure. Such a Hamiltonian is derived without making use of the single-mode adiabatic approximation, and hence it enables us to incorporate multi-mode effects in cavity optomechanics. By performing second quantization, we show how a set of generalized Fock states can be constructed to represent quantum states of the membrane and cavity field. In addition, we discuss examples showing how photon scattering among different cavity modes would modify the interaction strengths and the mechanical frequency of the membrane.
